Entries.default: Several men and women appear to be locked inside a cage of some kind. They're little more than silhouettes behind the glass, pointing and gesturing excitedly.

The animancers have gathered in front of the cage, where they confer with wide, wondering gestures. 

One of them, a thirtyish woman with a serious demeanor, notices you and points.
"Please, help us!"
"Be careful. The tunnels below may have collapsed."
"We will remain here to see to our dead."

"You out there! Are the beasts gone?"

One woman comes up to the door, hands pressed against the glass.
"I took care of the creatures."
[Leave] "I'll be right back."
[Examine the door.]
You can see no means of opening the door from the outside. It appears the cage is locked from within.
"Open this door."
"We are scholars, not soldiers." She shakes her head vigorously, pointing past you at the corpses.

The woman turns away to have a muffled exchange with the others.

Then, she pulls at something by the door, and you hear a rattling clank.

"You went into the ruins! Did you find survivors? In hiding, perhaps?"

She looks past you at the darkened passageway. Desperate, feeble hope flickers in her eyes.
"No."
"I'm sorry. If it's any comfort, I think they died quickly."
"Oh, sure. Playing dice with the imps and phantoms!"
"It is not, but thank you for trying." She lowers her head.
"We feared as much."
"Bazzo, is that necessary?" She scowls at you.
"I take it you are going back to Port Maje, yes? Governor Clario will want to hear of this."
"We will stay here to pay respects to our dead."
"I am sorry that we cannot accompany you, but-"
"I shall go with them, Benessa."

A sharp-featured elf comes to the fore. As he meets your eyes, he gives you a knowing nod.

He's earned a few new scars, but you recognize Aloth Corfiser all the same. 

He taps a finger to his lips, a sly smile working its way across them.
"After all, the jungle can be perilous. And the beasts that were here could not have gone far."
"Ac, as you say, Engferth." She turns to Aloth, a despondent cast to her frown.
"Engferth?"
"Let's go."
"Not much of an animancer, but he is - gods be thanked - a competent wizard."
"Is it safe to come out yet?"
"Is it safe to come out yet?"
"The bodies are cleared, but there is still so much work to be done."
"You killed Clario! Away from me, murderer!"
You start to approach the elf, but a thirtyish woman with a serious demeanor notices you and points.
